bibl.title: Hellenism as a Vehicle for Local Traditions in Third-century Egypt: The Evidence from Panopolis.
bibl.note: Greek civic life, Hellenism and local traditions. - Building programs. - Titles and epithets of Panopolis. - Panhellenic Games. - Names. - Conclusion.

bibl.title: Faces of Hellenism. Studies in the History of the Eastern Mediterranean (4th Century B.C. - 5th Century A.D.)

bibl.seg: GEENS Karolien, Hellenism as a Vehicle for Local Traditions in Third-century Egypt: The Evidence from Panopolis.

Peter VAN NUFFELEN (Ed.), Faces of Hellenism. Studies in the History of the Eastern Mediterranean (4th Century B.C. - 5th Century A.D.) = Studia Hellenistica. 48 (Leuven - Paris - Walpole, Mass., 2009) pp. 289-319.
Greek civic life, Hellenism and local traditions. - Building programs. - Titles and epithets of Panopolis. - Panhellenic Games. - Names. - Conclusion.
